summary: I'm rewatching the opening scene and right after Bran said "the things we do for love", Dany asks "then why have you abandoned...
body: I’m rewatching the opening scene and right after Bran said “the things we do for love”, Dany asks “then why have you abandoned your house and family now?” and Jaime LOOKS TO BRIENNE’S SIDE. HE TURNS TOWARDS BRIENNE AND SAYS “BECAUSE THIS GOES BEYOND LOYALTY”. NOW I’M NOT SAYING THIS MEANS HE LOVES BRIENNE BUT THAT’S EXACTLY WHAT IT MEANS. HE LOVES BRIENNE. HE LOVES SER BRIENNE OF HOUSE TARTH. JAIME AND BRIENNE ARE IN LOVE F I G H T M E

summary: The Highest Paid ‘Game of Thrones’ Star Is Revealed And There's More Than One Correct Answer!
title: The Highest Paid ‘Game of Thrones’ Star Is Revealed And There's More Than One Correct Answer!
excerpt: Find out which actors earn more from the hit HBO series Game of Thrones. Apparently, the answer seems to be in a tie with the 5 major actors of the show. All of them tend to earn $500,000 each per episode. The Highest Paid ‘Game of Thrones’ Star Is Revealed And There's More Than One Correct Answer!

summary:
I know noone asked for it, but nonetheless, I'll share you my toughts about it. 
I love how Jaime developed during the series. I...
body:
SPOILERS FOR GAME OF THRONES SEASON 8 EPISODE 2!!

I know noone asked for it, but nonetheless, I’ll share you my toughts about it.

I love how Jaime developed during the series. I hated him at first, but he is one of my favourite characters, and I think a lot of people thinks the same.

Arya finally had sex which could be very controversial, depend on what are your feeling towards her character. Half of the fans, including me loved it, but as I see there are a few very good reasons not to love it.

Brienne is finally a knight, despite she didn’t want to be one. Or at least she said she doesn’t want to. But her feelings were pure and true, she couldn’t hide them and finally after Renly’s death she were happy.

Bran is creepy still but strangely he talked more in this episode than the last 3 seasons full. I was really looking forward to the meeting with Jaime and to be honest, I was exppecting a little more from it but wasn’t disappointed either. They talked, I don’t think Bran lied about the forgiveness.

The tensity between Dany and Sansa didn’t lowered, altough I certainly hoped so. I already see the main rivalriy during the season. But I hope I’m wrong.

I don’t think Dany will kill any of the Jon-Sam-Bran trio because of the Targaryen thing, at least as long as she really thinks it’s a bad joke. But I see the problems between Dany and Sam. But as Sam said, I don’t think she will let Jon sit on the throne, ( I know Jon doesn’t want to sit on it) and won’t let her titles go as Jon did.

There were also too much happy stuff in these two episodes, far too much for GoT, it means we are going to need a psychologist after the end as Gwendolin said.

Anyone has any thoughts about it?

tags: who lives who dies who tells your story
body:
GoT Talk

idk how this is supposed to end.

Jon does not want to rule, and tbh he is kinda a bad leader? I mean, he can lead a small group, or something with an explicit purpose, but outside of that he tends to get sidetracked. Jon couldn’t hold the 7 Kingdoms and he definitely can’t do the day-to-day ruling. Him winning would be in direct conflict with the goal of the series: to undermine the idea that a good man is a good king.

Dany is slowly being changed by her time in Westeros. She’s always been ruthless, but only when needed. I think she’s frustrated, because across the Narrow Sea she has a cultural advantage. With Jorah’s help she brought Westerosi warfare and combined it with all she’d learned. But now in Westeros she’s doing what she heard in stories, not knowing how deep the hate and mistrust of her family goes in the kingdoms, but especially in the North. She’s falling back on brutality instead of rising above it. She has to show the North that she is trustworthy and just, but her darker side is getting the better of her.

Sansa: my bitch. Will be Queen of the North. Dany gotta get over it. At this point, I feel like she’s the best choice for the Iron Throne, but I seriously doubt she will ever return to King’s Landing. I’m not sure how this is gonna happen, but it has to.

Dragons: with either all die, or only 1 will live.

Gendry: gonna die. He’s here to break Arya’s heart

Jamie: gonna die. Maybe saving Dany? or Brienne?

Jorah: gonna die, but not right away

Theon: lives

Bran: lives

Sam: dies, last wish is for Jon to.be king, furthering jon and dany’s conflict

Hound: dies

Tormund: dies

Arya: lives, travelling the world

Tyrion: lives. He is Tallyrand.

Gilly: dies

Little Sam: survives, adopted by Sansa, maybe?

That’s all I got right now.
